dn8:1.2: A Kosalan town at which King Paseandi visited the Buddha in [mn90]().
dn8:1.3: Kassapa is an ancient clan name of the brahmins, and we meet many individuals of that name in the canon.
dn8:13.2: Note the va, which is ignored by RD and MW. Comm, however, takes it in exclusive sense, referring back to the Brahmajala. The usage is similar to, eg. eso’va maggo, natthi anno, and, given the context, it seems likely this exclusive sense was meant here.
dn8:14.11: vekaṭikopi hoti vikaṭabhojanānuyogamanuyutto means eating urine, etc. see MN 12.
